intro: Greigia berteroi, commonly known as the Mexican evergreen, is a member of the Ericaceae family and is native to Mexico. It is a shrub that typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are evergreen and dense, providing a compact appearance. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. Due to its hardy nature and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
